page.title: 02LAND USE AROUND AYLESFORD
page.content: Our area is on the north side of the geological structure of the Weald.It includes three different rock types.The northern edge of the Folkestone sand is exposed along the south edge of the block.This is mostly covered with woodland but building sand is extracted from a large area adjacent to Aylesford.Gault Clay extends over the greater part of the block and provides the subsoil for most of the agricultural land.Chalk outcrops in the northeast corner of the block producing high ground coveredin woodlands.A group of children from St Peters recorded on a map the crops of each field.Commonest crops are:wheat/barley,fruit,hops.The waste ground is mostly disused chalk and clay pits.The grazing mainly feeds sheep,with some horses,beef cattle and goats.
